III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth K said Staff 1 rubbed her thigh on 4/30/34.
Investigation I was assigned this investigation on 5/3/24.
Interviews:
I notified Youth K’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation
assignment, and she expressed no additional licensing concerns.
I contacted Complainant and notified him of the investigation
assignment. He expressed no additional concerns.
I collaborated with Government Worker suggesting he arrange a
forensic interview for Youth K via Kids-Talk. Government Worker
1 said Youth K’s Foster Care Worker saw her on 5/1/24 at the
facility and Youth K did not tell her Staff 1 rubbed her thigh, rather
she told the worker everything was fine. Additionally, Government
Worker 2 and I had interviewed Youth K on 5/2/24 about another
matter and she also did not tell us she was sexually abused by
Staff 1.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker and Rights
Officer present on 5/7/24. He has worked at the facility for five
months. Staff 1 was on administrative leave pending the outcome
of this investigation. Government Worker 1 read the allegation
aloud. Staff 1 responded, “I don’t recall that situation. It never
happened. I only use fist bumps. Otherwise, I have no physical
contact with youths. I talk to Youth K sparingly. At no time am I
ever alone with her.”
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker and Rights
Officer present. She has worked at the facility contingent for
seven years. Staff 2 recalled working with Staff 1 on 4/30/24. “I
don’t recall that happening. I never observed anything
2

inappropriate between Staff 1 and Youth K or any residents. I’ve
only worked with Staff 1 once or twice.”
I interviewed Team Leader with Government Worker and Rights
Officer present. He has worked at the facility for one year and
supervises Staff 1. Team Leader attested that Staff 1 has
appropriate boundaries with the youths. He added “Youth K has
boundary issues. I have to ask her to dress appropriately at night
and to keep space from male staff. We warn male staff to keep
their distance from her.”
I interviewed Staff 3 jointly with Government Worker and Rights
Officer present. She has worked at the facility for nine months.
Staff 3 recalled working with Staff 1. She stated “Staff 1 has
strong boundaries. He doesn’t like being left alone with youth and
will seek out female staff…He is always appropriate with female
residents.” On the other hand, Staff 3 added “Youth K comes out
of her room with nothing under her nightgown and gets angry
when redirected.”
I interviewed Youth A jointly with Government Worker. She said
she knows Staff 1 and never observed anything inappropriate
between Staff 1 and Youth K.
I interviewed Youth C jointly with Government Worker. She
recalled the day of 4/30/24. “I was in the room sitting right there!”
she protested. “Staff 1 didn’t even touch her. He doesn’t even let
us get close to him. He’s not like that. Youth K has been saying
everybody’s touching her. She lies all the time and never tells the
truth. Youth K said something about a supervisor too and he is in
his office all the time.”
I interviewed Youth V jointly with Government Worker. She said
she was asleep on 4/30/24 and never observed anything
inappropriate between Staff 1 and Youth K. Youth V added, “This
is how Youth K is. She always says things about staff – about
what they aren’t doing. Staff 1 never gave me that vibe. He’s a
nice man.”
Youth K was unable to attend a forensic interview at Kids-Talk
scheduled on 5/22/24 because she was psychiatrically
hospitalized. A second interview was scheduled on 6/5/24.
However, two hours prior to the interview, therapist asked that it
be rescheduled as Youth K was currently a truancy risk and on
one-to-one supervision for self-harming behaviors.
3

On 6/5/24 this investigation was transferred from Government
Worker to Government Worker 2. Government Worker 2
requested a third forensic interview at Kids-Talk. Kids-Talk
would not reschedule the interview until Youth K was deemed no
longer suicidal or at risk of self-harm.
Youth K was interviewed by Forensic Interviewer at Kids-Talk on
6/24/24 with Government Worker 2 and I present in another room
observing the interview via video in real time. Forensic
Interviewer reviewed the rules of the interview and built a rapport
with Youth K. Youth K shared “I was sexually assaulted by a staff
member” who she identified as Staff 1. “I was on the edge of
tears after talking to my member. Staff 1 was sitting on purple
wing at a desk under the camera. I walked in and sat by the
windowsill and looked out the window. Staff 1 moved his chair
closer to me. He put his hand on my shoulder and right thigh and
moved closer to my private area. He rubbed his hand on my thigh
saying, ‘It’s going to be okay.’ He rubbed my thigh with his thumb.
I told him not to touch me and pushed him away. I said I don’t
want your comfort and he stopped. I went to the bathroom and
started crying.”
Video
I viewed video footage on 4/30/24 at the time of the alleged
incident with Government Worker. Staff 1 and Youth K appeared
to be in the general area sitting separately in chairs beneath and
outside of the camera’s view. There was no physical contact
captured on video.
Government Worker 2 had no findings.
Analysis There is no evidence that Staff 1 touched Youth K inappropriately
or is unable to perform his job duties as assigned.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
